design_philosophy.name: Electric Scholar
design_philosophy.aesthetic: Swiss Textbook meets Modern SaaS. High legibility, generous whitespace, electric blue accents against paper-white backgrounds.

usage_rules: CRITICAL: Use 'Inter' for all body text, inputs, and UI elements.
Body text must be legible: leading-relaxed.
Do not use bold weights (700+) for body text. Use 500 or 600 for emphasis.
Primary Blue (#0B6FFF) is for CTAs and active states ONLY. Do not overuse.
Use Slate-50 (#F8FAFC) for section backgrounds to create depth without lines.
Text should never be pure black (#000000). Use Slate-900 (#0F172A).
Use Yellow (#FACC15) sparingly for 'Highlighter' effects on key words.

buttons.primary: bg-[#0B6FFF] text-white hover:bg-[#0055CC] rounded-full px-8 py-3 font-medium transition-all shadow-lg shadow-blue-500/25 hover:shadow-blue-500/40 hover:-translate-y-0.5
buttons.secondary: bg-white text-slate-900 border border-slate-200 hover:bg-slate-50 rounded-full px-8 py-3 font-medium transition-all
buttons.ghost: text-slate-600 hover:text-[#0B6FFF] hover:bg-blue-50 rounded-full px-6 py-2 transition-colors

cards.default: bg-white border border-slate-100 rounded-xl shadow-sm hover:shadow-md transition-shadow p-6
cards.interactive: group bg-white border border-slate-100 rounded-xl shadow-sm hover:shadow-xl hover:shadow-blue-500/10 hover:border-blue-100 transition-all duration-300 cursor-pointer

inputs.default: h-12 rounded-lg border-slate-200 focus:border-[#0B6FFF] focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-100 transition-all

visual_enhancers.textures: Use subtle noise overlays on solid blue backgrounds to reduce digital flatness.

instructions_to_main_agent: 1. FILE EXTENSIONS: The project uses .jsx files, NOT .tsx. Adjust all imports and file creations accordingly.
2. SHADCN: The components are already installed in /app/frontend/src/components/ui/. Use them. Do not reinstall.
3. ICONS: Use 'lucide-react' for icons. It is the standard for Shadcn.
4. ROUTING: Ensure 'react-router-dom' is used for navigation.
5. RESPONSIVE: Always design Mobile-First. Use 'md:' and 'lg:' prefixes for desktop layouts.
6. DATA-TESTID: Add 'data-testid' to all interactive elements (buttons, inputs, links) for testing.
7. MOCK DATA: Since the backend might not be ready, create a 'mockData.js' file to populate the UI with realistic content.
8. BILINGUAL: Prepare the UI structure to handle text swapping (English/Hindi), even if the translation logic isn't fully implemented yet.
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: You tend to converge toward generic, 'on distribution' outputs. In frontend design, this creates what users call the 'AI slop' aesthetic. Avoid this: make creative, distinctive frontends that surprise and delight.
Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur)
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: 'transition: all'. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add '.App { text-align: center; }' in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style
